benchmark_details.name: CoCoHD (Congress Committee Hearing Dataset)
benchmark_details.overview: The Congress Committee Hearing Dataset (CoCoHD) is the first and largest open-source dataset of congressional hearings, containing 32,697 curated transcripts and metadata from 1997 to 2024, covering 86 congressional committees, designed to facilitate research and natural language processing applications in analyzing congressional discourses.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a comprehensive dataset for analyzing U.S. congressional hearings and their impact on policy language concerning critical issues.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: Annotation process complexity and potential biases due to focus on U.S. Congress.

data.source: U.S. Congressional hearings from GovInfo, compiled and curated.
data.annotation: Manually annotated by authors with relevant and irrelevant labels for exploring sentiments on energy.

methodology.calculation: Calculated based on the proportion of relevant sentences categorized as supportive or opposing fossil fuel production.
methodology.interpretation: Positive values indicate pro-fossil fuel sentiment, while negative values indicate pro-clean energy sentiment.
methodology.validation: Case study demonstrating effectiveness in correlating congressional sentiment with market trends.
